Class TwitController

java.lang.Object
com.socialmedia.postly.controller.TwitController
@RestController @RequestMapping("/api/twits") public class TwitController extends Object
REST controller that exposes endpoints for creating, retrieving, replying, retweeting and deleting "twits".

Endpoints are rooted at /api/twits and expect the application to resolve the active user via a JWT stored in the request cookies using JwtUtils and UserService.

  • Method Details

    • createTwit

      @PostMapping(value="/create", consumes="multipart/form-data") public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<TwitDto> createTwit(@RequestPart Twit req, @RequestPart(required=false) org.springframework.web.multipart.MultipartFile image, @RequestPart(required=false) org.springframework.web.multipart.MultipartFile video, jakarta.servlet.http.HttpServletRequest request) throws IOException
      Create a new twit. Accepts multipart form data for optional image and video files along with a Twit payload.
      Parameters:
      req - the Twit entity payload (text and metadata)
      image - optional image file uploaded with the twit
      video - optional video file uploaded with the twit
      request - the current HTTP servlet request (used to read JWT cookie)
      Returns:
      a ResponseEntity containing the created TwitDto and HTTP status 201 CREATED
      Throws:
      IOException - when file handling (image/video) fails

    • getImage

      @GetMapping(value="/image/{filename}", produces="image/jpeg") public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<org.springframework.core.io.Resource> getImage(@PathVariable String filename) throws IOException
      Serve an image file previously uploaded for a twit.
      Parameters:
      filename - the filename of the image to return (relative to the `images` directory)
      Returns:
      a ResponseEntity with the image resource and appropriate content type, or 404 NOT FOUND
      Throws:
      IOException - if probing the file's content type or reading the file fails

    • replyTwit

      @PostMapping(value="/reply", consumes="multipart/form-data") public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<TwitDto> replyTwit(@RequestPart TwitReplyRequest req, @RequestPart org.springframework.web.multipart.MultipartFile image, jakarta.servlet.http.HttpServletRequest request) throws IOException
      Create a reply to an existing twit. Accepts a TwitReplyRequest and an optional image.
      Parameters:
      req - the reply request payload containing parent twit id and text
      image - optional image file attached to the reply
      request - the current HTTP servlet request (used to read JWT cookie)
      Returns:
      a ResponseEntity containing the created reply TwitDto and HTTP status 201 CREATED
      Throws:
      IOException - when file handling fails

    • reTwit

      @PutMapping("/{twitId}/retweet") public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<TwitDto> reTwit(@PathVariable Long twitId, jakarta.servlet.http.HttpServletRequest request)
      Retweet (repost) an existing twit on behalf of the authenticated user.
      Parameters:
      twitId - the id of the twit to retweet
      request - the current HTTP servlet request (used to read JWT cookie)
      Returns:
      a ResponseEntity containing the updated TwitDto and HTTP status 200 OK

    • findTwitById

      @GetMapping("/{twitId}") public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<TwitDto> findTwitById(@PathVariable Long twitId, jakarta.servlet.http.HttpServletRequest request)
      Retrieve a twit by its id and map it to a DTO for the authenticated user.
      Parameters:
      twitId - id of the twit to retrieve
      request - the current HTTP servlet request (used to read JWT cookie)
      Returns:
      a ResponseEntity containing the found TwitDto and HTTP status 200 OK

    • deleteTwit

      @DeleteMapping("/{twitId}") public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<ApiResponse> deleteTwit(@PathVariable Long twitId, jakarta.servlet.http.HttpServletRequest request)
      Delete a twit owned by the authenticated user.
      Parameters:
      twitId - id of the twit to delete
      request - the current HTTP servlet request (used to read JWT cookie)
      Returns:
      a ResponseEntity containing an ApiResponse and HTTP status 200 OK

    • getAllTwits

      @GetMapping("/") public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<List<TwitDto>> getAllTwits(jakarta.servlet.http.HttpServletRequest request)
      Retrieve all twits and map them to DTOs for the authenticated user.
      Parameters:
      request - the current HTTP servlet request (used to read JWT cookie)
      Returns:
      a ResponseEntity containing a list of TwitDto and HTTP status 200 OK

    • getUsersAllTwits

      @GetMapping("/user/{userId}") public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<List<TwitDto>> getUsersAllTwits(@PathVariable Long userId, jakarta.servlet.http.HttpServletRequest request)
      Retrieve all twits for the specified user id. Note: this controller resolves the currently authenticated user as context but the endpoint receives the target user's id as a path variable.
      Parameters:
      userId - id of the user whose twits should be returned
      request - the current HTTP servlet request (used to read JWT cookie)
      Returns:
      a ResponseEntity containing a list of TwitDto and HTTP status 200 OK

    • findTwitByLikesByUser

      @GetMapping("/user/{userId}/likes") public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<List<TwitDto>> findTwitByLikesByUser(@PathVariable Long userId, jakarta.servlet.http.HttpServletRequest request)
      Retrieve twits liked by the authenticated user.
      Parameters:
      userId - path variable present in the route but not used to determine the authenticated user (the controller resolves the user from JWT)
      request - the current HTTP servlet request (used to read JWT cookie)
      Returns:
      a ResponseEntity containing a list of TwitDto representing twits liked by the authenticated user and HTTP status 200 OK
